summary.para: Gets the source buffers that are actively supplying media data to the media source.

returns.para: The list of active source buffers.

returns.para: The duration of the media source in 100-nanosecond units.

summary.para: Gets the collection of source buffers associated with this media source.
Gets a value that indicates if the specified MIME type is supported by the media source.

param.name: type
param.para: The media type to check support for.

returns.para: true if the media type is supported; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Removes the specified source buffer from the collection of source buffers managed by the object.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets the duration of the media source in 100-nanosecond units.

param.name: duration
param.para: The duration of the media source in 100-nanosecond units.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Indicate that the end of the media stream has been reached.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Provides functionality for the Media Source Extension (MSE).

remarks.para: Media Source Extensions (MSE) is a World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) standard that extends the HTML5 media elements to enable dynamically changing the media stream without the use of plug-ins. The IMFMediaSourceExtension interface and the related Microsoft Win32 API implement MSE and are expected to only be called by web browsers implementing MSE.
The MSE media source keeps track of the ready state of the of the source as well as a list of objects which provide media data for the source.
